Data Structures | Typedefs | Enumerations | Functions | Variables
LSM6DSO I3C IMU Sensor Driver
devices

Detailed Description

Purpose: This module provides a comprehensive hardware abstraction layer for the ST Microelectronics LSM6DSO inertial measurement unit (IMU). The driver enables high-performance 3-axis accelerometer and gyroscope data acquisition through the I3C interface. It supports advanced features including configurable output data rates, full-scale ranges, temperature sensing, and I3C Common Command Codes (CCC) for dynamic addressing and device management.

Key Features

  1. 3-Axis Accelerometer: High-precision linear acceleration measurement.
  2. 3-Axis Gyroscope: Angular rate measurement with configurable sensitivity.
  3. Temperature Sensor: Integrated temperature measurement for calibration.
  4. I3C Interface: High-speed digital communication with CCC support.
  5. Dynamic Addressing: I3C SETDASA and RSTDAA command support.
  6. Configurable ODR: Multiple output data rates for power optimization.
  7. Multiple Full-Scale Ranges: Selectable sensitivity ranges for both sensors.
  8. DMA Support: Efficient data transfer with timeout and callback mechanisms.

Functionality

  • Initialize and configure LSM6DSO IMU sensor via I3C interface
  • Read raw acceleration data from 3-axis accelerometer
  • Read raw angular rate data from 3-axis gyroscope
  • Read temperature data for sensor compensation
  • Configure accelerometer and gyroscope output data rates and ranges
  • Handle I3C Common Command Codes for device management
  • Support dynamic I3C address assignment and reset operations
  • Provide device identification and status monitoring
  • Manage I3C read/write length limitations

Usage

  1. Initialize I3C host interface and configure I3C module
  2. Initialize LSM6DSO device with am_devices_i3c_lsm6dso_init()
  3. Configure sensor parameters (ODR, full-scale ranges) through register writes
  4. Read device ID with am_devices_i3c_lsm6dso_read_id() to verify communication
  5. Read acceleration data with am_devices_i3c_lsm6dso_acceleration_raw_get()
  6. Read gyroscope data with am_devices_i3c_lsm6dso_angular_rate_raw_get()
  7. Read temperature with am_devices_i3c_lsm6dso_temperature_raw_get()
  8. Monitor sensor status with am_devices_i3c_lsm6dso_get_status()
  9. Terminate device with am_devices_i3c_lsm6dso_term() when finished

Configuration

  • Set up I3C interface parameters and timing
  • Configure accelerometer output data rate and full-scale range
  • Configure gyroscope output data rate and full-scale range
  • Set up I3C dynamic addressing and device provisioning
  • Configure DMA parameters for efficient data transfer
  • Set up interrupt and FIFO configurations as needed
  • Optimize power consumption through ODR and operating mode selection

  AM_DEVICES_LSM6DSO_ODR_12Hz5 = 1 ,
  AM_DEVICES_LSM6DSO_ODR_26Hz = 2 ,
  AM_DEVICES_LSM6DSO_ODR_52Hz = 3 ,
  AM_DEVICES_LSM6DSO_ODR_104Hz = 4 ,

}

int16_t * pui16Data )

Get the acceleration data from lsm6dso sensor.

Parameters
pHandle- Pointer to device handle
pui16Data- Pointer to the 6 byte accelerometer data

This function read data from the sensor registers

Returns
32-bit status

◆ am_devices_i3c_lsm6dso_init()

uint32_t am_devices_i3c_lsm6dso_init ( uint32_t ui32Module,
void * pI3cHandle,
void ** ppDevHandle,
am_devices_i3c_lsm6dso_config_t * pDevConfig )

Initialize the lsm6dso sensor.

Parameters
ui32Module- I3C instance
pI3cHandle- I3C controller handle
ppDevHandle- Device handle which needs to be return
pDevConfig- I3C device structure describing the target sensor
Note
This function should be called before any other am_devices_i3c_lsm6dso functions. It is used to tell the other functions how to communicate with the I3C sensors.
Returns
Status.

◆ am_devices_i3c_lsm6dso_read_len_set()

uint16_t ui16ReadLen )

Set the maximum read length via direct CCC.

Parameters
pHandle- Pointer to device handle
ui16ReadLen- maximum read length

This function read data from the sensor registers

Returns
32-bit status

◆ am_devices_i3c_lsm6dso_read_reg()

uint32_t am_devices_i3c_lsm6dso_read_reg ( void * pHandle,
uint8_t ui8ReadAddr,
uint32_t * pui32Data,
uint32_t ui32NumBytes )

Read generic device register from lsm6dso sensor.

Parameters
pHandle- Pointer to device handle
ui8ReadAddr- Address of desired data in sensor
pui32Data- Buffer to store the received data from sensor
ui32NumBytes- Number of bytes to read from sensor
pfnCallback- I3C device call back function
pCallbackCtxt- I3C device callback context

This function read data from the given register of sensor, and returns the result as an 32-bit unsigned integer value.

Returns
32-bit status

◆ am_devices_i3c_lsm6dso_send_cccs()

uint32_t am_devices_i3c_lsm6dso_send_cccs ( void * pHandle,
uint32_t * pui32Data,
uint8_t ui8CccId )

Send I3C Common Command Codes.

Parameters
pHandle- Pointer to device handle
pui32Data- Buffer to config sensor or save current configuration
ui8CccId- Common command code index

This function sends I3C CCCs to sensor to configure or get sensor information

Returns
32-bit status

◆ am_devices_i3c_lsm6dso_write_reg()

uint32_t am_devices_i3c_lsm6dso_write_reg ( void * pHandle,
uint8_t ui8WriteAddr,
uint32_t * pui32Data,
uint32_t ui32NumBytes )

Write generic device register of lsm6dso sensor.

Parameters
pHandle- Pointer to device handle
ui8WriteAddr- Address of desired data in sensor
pui32Data- Buffer to write the sensor data from
ui32NumBytes- Number of bytes to write to sensor

This function write data to the given register of sensor, and returns the result as an 32-bit unsigned integer value.

Returns
32-bit status
